Topic.Title: Better than Yelp, Angi, Zillow, Open Table or MeetMe - All Yahoo should not buy

Message.Msg: Local Corporation Launches “Fusion by Local” Premium Ad Network to Serve $3.4 Billion Local Display Ad Market . Gives Advertisers Reach Into Local Markets; Publishers Access to Top Brands and Additional Ad Revenue Press Release: Local Corporation – 54 minutes ago.. . IRVINE, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Local Corporation (LOCM), a leading online local media company, today announced the launch of “Fusion by Local,” a new premium ad network for advertisers and brand marketers seeking to engage with targeted local audiences in markets across the U.S. Fusion by Local gives advertisers the ability to reach targeted customers in local markets through premium display advertising inventory across some of the top media properties in the country, including sites in the company’s established network of over 1,000 regional media sites. The premium network also provides regional media publishers with access to national advertisers and brands to drive incremental advertising revenue through their media properties. With local display advertising on the rise and expected to grow 18.2 percent this year to $3.4 billion1, advertisers are seeking ways to more effectively engage their target audiences quickly and efficiently on a local level. National and regional brands that are looking to advertise locally are increasingly seeking premium ad positioning for their campaigns near relevant content, with high quality publishers and media sites.

Topic.Title: Yahoo to Buy....

Message.Msg: Hotmodel: Happy Easter! Actually, I've been on the Packers Season Ticket Waiting list since 1986, and I only got a chance at the 3 game set because of the 6,000 seats being added with the South Bowl Upper Deck expansion. So yep, it would be another 25 years for the 7 game package. Didn't want to wait until my mid 70's for that. MB is still alive and kicking and working on his project. He finally could not take the insanity postings on this board any longer so he has kind of written it off. I expect the world may hear something from him in the next few months as he seems to be reaching a launch point. Anyway, hope you and the family have a great Easter and please try and keep the microwave clean during the Peep Jousting Competitions. Grey.

Message.Title: A Facebook - Yahoo MERGER would make sense.
Message.Msg: Yahoo brings content and lots of unmonitized users; Facebook brings the best social networking currently available and potential readers for Yahoo's content. Neither is a leader in mobile access or search but that can be addressed later. As redundant and useless employees (mostly at Yahoo, I'm guessing) are eliminated or replaced there will be significant cost savings. I can envision 1 share of Facebook stock for each share of Yahoo or perhaps even a market price exchange. All shareholders benefit. Comments welcome - but note that if you are one of those message board users that keeps posting about Yahoo's stock price and answering his/her own posts, you are probably on my ignore user list.

Topic.Title: A Facebook - Yahoo MERGER would make sense.

Message.Msg: I agree with part of your post. AAPL, MSFT or whatever will not pay some absurd price over the market for a company that offers virtually no fit to their existing business and I believe that Yahoo, as before, would fight any takeover because protecting jobs is more important than rewarding sharenholders. However, Yahoo cannot surive much less prosper as a stand-alone company. There is more inertia than innovation and more incompetence than genius. Events move too fast in this industry for them to succeed. To me, a merger is a win/win situation.

Topic.Title: A Facebook - Yahoo MERGER would make sense.

Message.Msg: Facebook should buy Nokia, do a trade equal shares. Nokia will be number one worldwide in mobile phones, videos and other devices by 2015. Yahoo is another gold mine, Yahoo is worth $50 plus a share. I am long on both and will Buy more.

Message.Title: Low Float Tablet/Smartphone Play to Explode this Week
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) needs to double in early April to trade at a fair valuation vs. its #1 rival Seachange (SEAC). CCUR has gained 12 straight months and 8 of the past 9 trading days. Has the best looking chart with the most momentum, but not even close to a peak. Currently $7.91 and has had a lot of resistance at $8, but the resistance is 99% gone and as soon as CCUR breaks $8 strongly, it could rapidly breakout to the $12-$15 range. CCUR's EPS last quarter was double quarter before and quadruple two quarters ago. SEAC is currently $11.89 and expected to soon report full year non-GAAP EPS of $0.40 for a P/E of 30. CCUR's non-GAAP EPS last quarter of $0.125 equals $0.50 annualized and a P/E of 30 would value CCUR at $15 per share. Almost all of the $8 resistance is now gone and as soon as CCUR breaks out big above $8, it could absolutely explode to $15 without any major resistance in between! CCUR is the global video on demand (VOD) technology leader for the pay-TV industry. CCUR has total global reach of 54mm VOD homes and 23mm of them are in the U.S. CCUR's main U.S. VOD clients are Time Warner Cable, Cox, Charter, and Bright House. CCUR has 30% global VOD market share and a 65% market share for "start over" a new service that CCUR launched for Time Warner Cable and Bright House that their subscribers repeatedly rate their favorite pay-TV feature. CCUR recently won U.S. patent for their about to launch network DVR technology based over the cloud that will eliminate need for physical DVR devices!
